alert.note: Alert for Marion; Ralls (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 3:49PM CDT until March 31 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Pike County in west central Illinois... South central Adams County in west central Illinois... Northern Ralls County in northeastern Missouri... Southeastern Marion County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 349 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Center, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has a history of producing ping pong ball size hail. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... New London, Rensselaer and Spaulding around 400 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Hannibal, Fall Creek, Payson and Barry. This includes the following highways... Interstate 172 near exit 2. Interstate 72 between exits 4 and 20. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois...and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois...and northeastern Missouri.
